    <item> 
      <title>PPI victims 'should have got Â£5bn more'</title>  
      <description>Twelve million consumers who were mis-sold Payment Protection Insurance (PPI) should have got an extra Â£5bn, a group of MPs has said.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36278064#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36278064</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:00:31 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>UK banks shut 600 branches in last year</title>  
      <description>More than 600 bank branches have closed across the UK in the last year, with rural areas worst affected, according to figures obtained by the BBC.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36268324#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36268324</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:00:12 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Tesco boss takes home Â£3m bonus</title>  
      <description>Tesco chief executive Dave Lewis is paid a bonus of almost Â£3 for helping return the UK's biggest supermarket to profit.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36284194#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36284194</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:14:49 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Apple invests in Chinese Uber rival</title>  
      <description>Apple invests $1bn (Â£693m) in Didi Chuxing, the car-hailing app that has a bigger market share than Uber in China.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36283661#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36283661</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:18:41 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>German growth best for two years</title>  
      <description>The German economy more than doubled its economic growth rate in the first quarter of the year to its best performance in two years, according to official figures.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36284549#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36284549</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 07:21:33 GMT</pubDate>  
      <media:thumbnail width="66" height="37" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/6A52/production/_89681272_89505655.jpg"/>  
      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/9162/production/_89681273_89505655.jpg"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Brexit may spark recession, Carney warns</title>  
      <description>The Bank of England has given its starkest warning yet that a vote to leave the EU could hit the UK economy.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36273448#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36273448</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:38:44 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Fred Goodwin avoids charges over RBS</title>  
      <description>The Crown Office says former RBS bosses will not face criminal charges in connection with the sale of shares in the bank in the months leading up to its collapse.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-scotland-business-36276346#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-scotland-business-36276346</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:56:27 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>New global plan to recover stolen assets</title>  
      <description>A global plan to help speed up efforts to recover stolen assets is announced by David Cameron at an anti-corruption summit in London.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36274302#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36274302</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 15:54:21 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Apple shares drop to near two-year low</title>  
      <description>Shares in Apple fall below $90 (Â£62) for the first time in nearly two years as investors worry about slumping sales of iPhones.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36280482#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36280482</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 22:11:58 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Nissan shares up on Mitsubishi deal</title>  
      <description>Shares in Japanese carmaker Nissan rise by 4.1% on Friday after the company had clinched a deal to take a major stake in embattled rival Mitsubishi.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36283483#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36283483</guid>  
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 06:33:52 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Record jail term for former banker</title>  
      <description>A former senior investment banker and an accountant jailed for their part in the UK's most complex insider dealing investigation.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36277818#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36277818</guid>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>New M&S boss shakes up top team</title>  
      <description>The new boss of Marks and Spencer restructures his senior team in a move that has also resulted in the departure of five executives.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36277822#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Edinburgh to London budget rail service</title>  
      <description>A new budget rail service between Edinburgh and London is given the green light by the Rail Regulator.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-36273407#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>High heels-row firm changes policy</title>  
      <description>A firm accused of sexism after insisting a female receptionist had to wear high heels changes its policy to allow "plain flat shoes" at work.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-36272893#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: Indian artisans feel strain of beef ban</title>  
      <description>India supplies about 20% of all the beef in the world. But it's a topic of fierce political and religious debate.</description>

    <item> 
      <title>VIDEO: CES makes a splash in Shanghai</title>  
      <description>It's a show that's usually synonymous with Las Vegas - but the Consumer Electronics Show, or the CES, is on in Shanghai this week.</description>

      <title>VIDEO: Cattle slaughter ban hits Indian farmers</title>
